title: 112_s2337
content: The "Plain Writing Act for Regulations of 2012" requires Federal regulations to use plain writing to enhance public understanding and increase public participation in the rulemaking process. SEC. 3. DEFINITIONS. This section defines key terms such as "agency," "Director," "plain writing," and "regulation." The Act requires agencies to designate a senior official to oversee implementation, ensure plain writing does not hinder scientific analyses, and communicate the requirements to employees. The Act mandates agencies to designate a senior official to oversee implementation, ensure plain writing does not hinder scientific analyses, and communicate the requirements to employees. This official is also responsible for training employees in plain writing, overseeing compliance, and serving as a point of contact for public input. The Plain Writing Act of 2010 requires agencies to use plain writing in new and revised regulations within 12 months of enactment. Agency heads must certify compliance by ensuring proposed or final rules use plain writing. Information collection for regulations is exempt from certain provisions if the agency head certifies plain writing usage. Agency heads can exempt information collection for regulations from certain provisions of the Plain Writing Act of 2010 if they certify that the sole reason is to improve the clarity of the regulation. SEC. 5. RESPONSIBILITIES OF THE DIRECTOR OF THE OFFICE OF MANAGEMENT AND BUDGET. The Director of the Office of Management and Budget must develop guidance within 6 months of the Act's enactment to ensure agencies understand that using plain writing does not hinder scientific or technical analyses. The Director may designate a lead agency and publish certifications on the official website. The Act requires agencies to publish reports on compliance with plain writing requirements, with an initial report due within 9 months and annual reports thereafter. The Comptroller General must also submit annual reports to specific committees on agency compliance. The Oversight and Government Reform of the House of Representatives evaluates regulations for plain writing, measuring comprehension and satisfaction. It also assesses how plain writing increases public participation in the rulemaking process. The Oversight and Government Reform of the House of Representatives evaluates regulations for plain writing to enhance public understanding and increase participation in the rulemaking process. It provides recommendations to improve compliance with the Act and use plain writing effectively. SEC. 7. JUDICIAL REVIEW AND ENFORCEABILITY. This Act prohibits judicial review of compliance with its provisions and states that no right or benefit can be enforced through administrative or judicial action.
